intro: Securidaca yaoshanensis, commonly known as the Yaoshan dittander, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in forested areas and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
